title: Create a New Wallet

children.value: Never share your seed phrase with anyone. Those who know your seed phrase will have access to your funds!
Launch your web wallet and "Create new wallet."
Double-check your spelling! Don't let a misspelling like 'funnel' and 'tunnel' prevent you from accessing your funds!
Record your seed phrase (pen and paper recommended) and store it in a secure location. Do not screenshot your seed phrase or keep it on an electronic device where it is vulnerable to cyber attacks!
Enter six randomly select words from your seed phrase to complete the verification process.

Select a password (ten characters minimum, at least one letter, number, or special symbol) that will give you access to your Beam wallet. Your wallet password is an extra lock for your device, while your seed phrase is a private key that identifies your wallet and can access your funds.
Choose a strong password, then select "start using your wallet."
Congratulations! Your Beam web wallet is now ready! Send or Receive Beam, view your most recent transactions list directly from the Beam web wallet dashboard.
Launch your web wallet and "Create new wallet."

Select a password (ten characters minimum, at least one letter, number, or special symbol) that will give you access to your Beam wallet. Your wallet password is an extra lock for your device, while your seed phrase is a private key that identifies your wallet and can access your funds.
Choose a strong password, then select "start using your wallet."
Congratulations! Your Beam web wallet is now ready! Send or Receive Beam, view your most recent transactions list directly from the Beam web wallet dashboard!

title: Easy Onboarding

children.value: Your seed phrase is the only way you (or anybody) can access your funds. Your seed phrase is not linked to your email or phone number. If you forget your wallet password or lose your device, the only way to restore your wallet is through your seed phrase!

The easiest way. After installation and clicking on the button “Create new wallet”, a user can skip the step about verifying seed by clicking on “I will do it later”. Take a look at the following screenshots.
Select "I understand" to continue to the next step of the verification process.
Beam web wallet users can skip the seed verification process (click "I will do it later") and start using their  web wallets right away.
: not recording and verifying your seed phrase could result in the loss of your Beam coins!

Select a password (eight characters minimum, at least one letter, number, or special symbol) that will give you access to your Beam wallet. Your wallet password is an extra lock for your device, while your seed phrase is a private key that identifies your wallet and can access your funds.
Now that your web wallet is created, it's to synchronize with blockchain in its most current state on the Beam network.
This may take a few minutes depending on your internet connection.
Once your web wallet synchs with the blockchain, you are ready to started using your Web Wallet.
Send or Receive Beam coins, see your most recent transactions directly from your Beam wallet dashboard!

title: How-to Create Beam Web Wallet
description: There are two ways of how user can create new wallet: Easy onboarding and Create a new wallet with the seed phrase verification

children.value: There are two ways of how user can create new wallet:
Create a new wallet with the seed phrase verification

title: Seed Verification
description: Easy onboarding only allows you to delay verifying your seed phrase. Verifying your seed phrase is crucial for recovering your funds if you ever lose your password or need to reformat your computer.

children.value: If you skip the seed verification process, your web wallet will give you pop-up reminders to verify your wallet. You can close these pop-ups, but once your wallet balance exceeds 100 Beams, the notification will stay open until you secure your seed phrase.
Select “secure your phrase” to start the seed verification process.
You will receive a prompt to asking you to confirm your wallet password before moving to the next step of the seed verification process.
Record your seed phrase (pen and paper recommended), make multiple copies and store them somewhere safe. Your seed phrase is for your eyes only. Never share your seed phrase with anyone!
Enter six randomly selected words of your seed phrase to complete the verification (and never see this pop-up window again).
Enter your web wallet password to continue verifying your seed phrase.

Record your seed phrase (pen and paper recommended), make multiple copies and keep it safe. Your seed phrase is not connected to your email address or phone number. Losing your seed phrase could result in you losing access to your funds.
Double-check your spelling before storing your seed phrase in a secure location. Never share your seed phrase with anyone!
Enter six randomly selected words of your seed phrase to complete the verification process.

title: How-to Install Beam Web Wallet
description: Download the Beam web wallet from Chrome Web Store  or download the packed extension directly on our Github page.

title: Wallet Dashboard
description: In this article, we will explore all the features the Beam web wallet offers.

children.value: In this article, we will explore all the features the Beam web wallet offers.

The dashboard displays the available balance of Beam coins in your wallet. Send or Receive Beam, view your most recent transactions list directly from the Beam web wallet dashboard! The "wallet" icon and "swap" icons (located on the left side of the dashboard, beneath "wallet status") represent your wallet dashboard, UTXO screen, respectively. The action menu in the top right corner stores additional wallet functionalities (
Security Mode, Payment proof, Settings, and more).
The dashboard displays the available balance of Beam remaining in your web wallet. View your most recent transactions, Send or Receive Beam directly from the wallet dashboard.
"Security mode" enables your web wallet to hide sensitive information (balance, transaction lists) from wandering eyes.
The dashboard displays the available balance of Beam remaining in your web wallet. View your most recent transactions, Send or Receive Beam directly from the wallet dashboard.›
"Security mode" enables your web wallet to hide sensitive information (balance, transaction lists) from wandering eyes.
SBBS addresses for Web Wallet are single-use only addresses.

Newly generated SBBS addresses expire after 12 hours.
{% endhint %}

title: Receiving Beam
description: As we continue to explore the features and functionality of the Beam web wallet, we move onto how-to Receive Beam coins.

children.value: SBBS addresses for Web Wallet are single-use only addresses.
Newly generated SBBS addresses expire after 12 hours.
Both Sender and Receiver wallets must be online to complete the transaction.
It is possible to reuse an existing address (more information on that later).
From your wallet dashboard, select "receive" to be directed the receiving window.
Copy and paste the newly generated Beam address (highlight right-click or "copy transaction address" from the drop-down menu) and forward it to the Sender over a
From your wallet dashboard, select "receive" to be directed the receiving window.
Copy and paste the newly generated Beam address (highlight right-click or "copy transaction address" from the drop-down menu) and forward it to the Sender over a

title: Sending Beam
description: An in-depth guide for how to Send Beam coins from your web wallet.

children.value: Always double-check your copied address before sending out your Beam coins! Malware, viruses, and other malicious actors on your computer can alter your address while copied to the clipboard!
When you have the Sending address, you are now ready to send Beam coins. Select the magenta-colored button, "send" from your wallet dashboard, directing you to the sending window.

Copy and paste the wallet address in the "transaction address" field. You can add a comment in "transaction comments" (the comment will only be visible to you) for easier bookkeeping. Confirm the amount of Beam coins you wish to send before clicking "next."
After clicking "next", the "transaction confirmation" window will pop-up and display the transaction details. Review and confirm before clicking "send."
When you have the Sending address, you are now ready to send Beam coins. Select the magenta-colored button, "send" from your wallet dashboard, directing you to the sending window.

Copy and paste the wallet address in the "transaction address" field. You can add a comment in "transaction comments" (the comment will only be visible to you) for easier bookkeeping. Confirm the amount of Beam coins you wish to send before clicking "next."
After clicking "next", the "transaction confirmation" window will pop-up and display the transaction details. Review and confirm before clicking "send."

title: Settings
description: An overview the different settings you can adjust in your Beam web wallet.

children.value: Find your Beam Wallet settings by clicking the action menu and selecting "settings".
The setting options of your Beam web wallet are:
"General" settings functionality is limited to clearing your local wallet data. Delete session logs, transactions from this menu.
Add an extra layer of protection to your web wallet by requiring re-entering your password for every Send transaction.
Earn some Beam from the Beam Community Faucet or view "payment proof" to verify transactions.

Report any Bugs or contact the Beam support team to submit session logs through the "Report a problem" menu. When reporting a problem, carefully read the pop-up menu instructions on how to submit your issue to
Delete your current wallet from the Beam network on this menu. Back up any metadata you wish to save before deleting your wallet.

title: UTXO
description: In this article, we will cover how UTXO's function within the Beam ecosystem.

children.value: UTXO (Unspent Transaction (TX) Output) is like a banknote of a specific amount. Simply said, if Beam is the currency, any UTXO can be considered a ‘bill’. You can have multiple ‘bills’ in your wallet at the same time. The UXTO represents the amount of cryptocurrency left after each transaction which then records the input for new transactions. Remaining outputs in your Beam web wallet can be found in the "UTXO" (swap icon) button of your wallet dashboard.
View the UTXOs controlled by your wallet on the UTXO dashboard. UTXOs have two types:
: UTXO received during a transaction. Immediately available for spending.
UTXO leftover from a transaction or the "change." Immediately available for spending.
Each UTXO type can undergo several transaction statuses (Available, In progress, Spent, Unavailable) labeled on each UTXO.

See how finished UTXO types, transaction statuses and available cash appears in the UXTO dashboard in the screenshots below. Select a specific UTXO to view more transaction details (this function is available on full browser view).
